title: Inversion
description: Слушайте предложения с инверсией для усиления смысла.

tasks.audioText: The journalist described the severity of the humanitarian crisis in her report. Never before had the region experienced such a devastating combination of drought and armed conflict.
tasks.transcript: Never before had the region experienced such a devastating combination of drought and armed conflict.

options.text: The region had previously experienced similar crises many times.
This was the worst combination of drought and conflict the region had ever seen.
The journalist predicted a future drought in the region.
The conflict ended before the drought began.

tasks.explanation: 'Never before had... experienced' uses inversion with a negative adverb to emphasise that this crisis was unprecedented.

tasks.audioText: The company's annual report highlighted several achievements. Not only did the firm exceed revenue targets, but it also expanded into four new international markets simultaneously.
tasks.transcript: Not only did the firm exceed revenue targets, but it also expanded into four new international markets simultaneously.

options.text: The firm missed its revenue goals but expanded internationally.
The firm surpassed revenue expectations and additionally entered four new foreign markets at once.
The firm only expanded into one new market.
Revenue targets were met but no international expansion occurred.

tasks.explanation: 'Not only did... but also' uses inversion to emphasise two impressive achievements: exceeding targets and international expansion.

tasks.audioText: The ceremony had just begun when something extraordinary happened. Hardly had the conductor raised his baton when the entire concert hall was plunged into complete darkness.
tasks.transcript: Hardly had the conductor raised his baton when the entire concert hall was plunged into complete darkness.

options.text: The concert continued without any interruptions.
The power went out after the concert had been going for a long time.
Almost immediately after the conductor lifted his baton, the concert hall went completely dark.
The conductor refused to start the performance.

tasks.explanation: 'Hardly had... when' uses inversion to show one action happened almost immediately after another. The blackout was instant.

tasks.audioText: The detective reflected on the most challenging case of her career. At no point during the investigation did she consider giving up despite overwhelming pressure from the media.
tasks.transcript: At no point during the investigation did she consider giving up despite overwhelming pressure from the media.

options.text: She never thought about quitting the case even with intense media scrutiny.
She almost gave up the investigation because of media pressure.
The media supported her throughout the investigation.
She was removed from the case due to media interference.

tasks.explanation: 'At no point did she consider' uses inversion with a negative expression to strongly emphasise her determination throughout.

tasks.audioText: The timing of the events was remarkable. No sooner had the president signed the trade agreement than the stock market surged to an all-time high.
tasks.transcript: No sooner had the president signed the trade agreement than the stock market surged to an all-time high.

options.text: The stock market crashed after the trade agreement was signed.
Immediately after the president signed the deal, the stock market reached a record level.
The stock market peak happened long before the agreement was signed.
The president refused to sign the trade agreement.

tasks.explanation: 'No sooner had... than' uses inversion to emphasise the immediate sequence: signing triggered an instant market surge.

tasks.audioText: The professor addressed the graduating class with a powerful speech. Rarely does one encounter a generation so well-equipped to tackle the challenges of artificial intelligence and climate change.
tasks.transcript: Rarely does one encounter a generation so well-equipped to tackle the challenges of artificial intelligence and climate change.

options.text: The professor said it is uncommon to find a generation as prepared for AI and climate challenges as this one.
The professor said this generation is not prepared for modern challenges.
Previous generations were better equipped for current challenges.
The professor rarely speaks at graduation ceremonies.

tasks.explanation: 'Rarely does one encounter' inverts to emphasise the exceptional quality of this generation's preparedness.

tasks.audioText: The expedition team finally reached the mountain summit after weeks of climbing. Only then did they realise the true magnitude of the challenge that still lay ahead of them.
tasks.transcript: Only then did they realise the true magnitude of the challenge that still lay ahead of them.

options.text: They understood the full difficulty before they reached the summit.
It was only at the summit that they grasped how enormous the remaining challenge really was.
Reaching the summit meant the entire challenge was behind them.
The team decided to turn back after reaching the summit.

tasks.explanation: 'Only then did they realise' uses inversion after 'only + time expression' to emphasise the delayed moment of understanding.

tasks.audioText: The literary critic reviewed the controversial novel. Seldom has a debut novel provoked such intense debate among scholars and ordinary readers alike.
tasks.transcript: Seldom has a debut novel provoked such intense debate among scholars and ordinary readers alike.

options.text: It is very rare for a first novel to generate this level of discussion among both experts and the public.
Debut novels frequently cause intense debates in literary circles.
Only scholars, not ordinary readers, discussed the novel.
The novel received no attention from either critics or the public.

tasks.explanation: 'Seldom has a debut novel provoked' uses inversion to highlight how unusual it is for a first novel to spark such widespread controversy.

tasks.audioText: The witness took the stand during the high-profile corruption trial. Under no circumstances would she reveal the identity of her confidential source to the prosecution.
tasks.transcript: Under no circumstances would she reveal the identity of her confidential source to the prosecution.

options.text: She agreed to reveal her source's identity under certain conditions.
She absolutely refused to disclose who her secret informant was, no matter what.
The prosecution already knew the identity of her source.
She accidentally revealed the source's name during questioning.

tasks.explanation: 'Under no circumstances would she reveal' uses inversion to express an absolute, unconditional refusal to disclose information.

tasks.audioText: The biographer described the artist's remarkable rise to fame. Little did the young painter know that her first exhibition would launch a career spanning five decades.
tasks.transcript: Little did the young painter know that her first exhibition would launch a career spanning five decades.

options.text: The young painter expected her first exhibition to make her famous.
The painter had no idea at the time that her debut show would start a fifty-year career.
The painter's career lasted only a few years after the first exhibition.
The first exhibition was a complete failure.

tasks.explanation: 'Little did she know' uses inversion to dramatically convey that the painter was unaware of the impact her first exhibition would have.

tasks.audioText: The surgeon described the complex emergency procedure to medical students. Not until the final scan results came through did the surgical team allow themselves to believe the operation had succeeded.
tasks.transcript: Not until the final scan results came through did the surgical team allow themselves to believe the operation had succeeded.

options.text: The team was confident from the start that the surgery would succeed.
The team only accepted the operation was successful after receiving the last scan results.
The final scan showed the operation had failed.
The team celebrated before the scan results were available.

tasks.explanation: 'Not until... did the team allow' uses inversion to stress that confirmation only came with the final scan results.

tasks.audioText: The CEO delivered a keynote address at the technology summit. Not once during his fifteen-year tenure had the company reported a quarterly loss until the global pandemic struck.
tasks.transcript: Not once during his fifteen-year tenure had the company reported a quarterly loss until the global pandemic struck.

options.text: The company had never had a losing quarter in fifteen years until the pandemic caused one.
The company regularly reported losses during the CEO's tenure.
The pandemic had no effect on the company's financial performance.
The CEO resigned after the first quarterly loss.

tasks.explanation: 'Not once had the company reported' uses inversion to emphasise the perfect financial record that was finally broken by the pandemic.

tasks.audioText: The diplomat recounted the tense negotiations at the peace summit. Only after twelve consecutive hours of discussions did both delegations finally agree on the terms of the ceasefire.
tasks.transcript: Only after twelve consecutive hours of discussions did both delegations finally agree on the terms of the ceasefire.

options.text: The delegations reached agreement quickly at the beginning of talks.
It took twelve straight hours of talks before the two sides finally accepted the ceasefire conditions.
The delegations failed to reach any agreement after twelve hours.
Only one delegation agreed to the ceasefire terms.

tasks.explanation: 'Only after twelve hours did both delegations agree' uses inversion to highlight how prolonged and difficult the negotiations were.

tasks.audioText: The financial analyst commented on the unprecedented market volatility. In no way does the current economic data suggest that a full recovery will occur within the next fiscal quarter.
tasks.transcript: In no way does the current economic data suggest that a full recovery will occur within the next fiscal quarter.

options.text: The economic data shows clear signs of recovery next quarter.
The current economic indicators absolutely do not point to a complete recovery in the coming quarter.
The analyst is optimistic about the economy's short-term prospects.
The market has already fully recovered from the volatility.

tasks.explanation: 'In no way does the data suggest' uses inversion with a negative phrase to strongly deny any expectation of imminent recovery.

tasks.audioText: The historian concluded her lecture on the space race with a powerful statement. Not since the first moon landing had a single scientific achievement captured the imagination of the entire world so completely.
tasks.transcript: Not since the first moon landing had a single scientific achievement captured the imagination of the entire world so completely.

options.text: Many scientific achievements after the moon landing were equally captivating.
Since the moon landing, no other scientific feat had so thoroughly fascinated the whole world.
The moon landing was not particularly important to the public.
The historian was discussing a recent space mission failure.

tasks.explanation: 'Not since... had a single achievement captured' uses inversion to compare the impact of a recent event to the historic moon landing.

short_description: Инверсия с отрицательными наречиями для усиления формального стиля.
